讲座标题: Intelligent networks and systems – Part 2 Network Digital Twins
地点: 网络视频，腾讯会议 ID：931150129
通知内容: Today’s communication network is becoming more and more complex due to the introduction of 5G and IoT/IIoT. Managing a network of this unprecedented complexity would benefit greatly from a digital twin. A network digital twin refers to a computer simulation model of the communication network, along with its operating environment and the application traffic that it carries. The digital twin can be used to study the behaviour of its physical counterpart under a diverse set of operating conditions, including cyber-attacks, and adjust its actual network configuration as needed. It could also be used for effective management of network infrastructure and keeping track of configuration changes. In this talk, I will first talk about network digital twins. Then, I will introduce our recent work that leverages network digital twins to carry out effective network management. Finally, I will talk about research challenges and open issues.

讲座标题: Intelligent networks and systems – Part 1 Anomaly Detection
地点: 网络视频，腾讯会议 ID：931150129
通知发布时间: 2021-12-21Cloud/edge computing systems are of paramount importance for the success of many computation-intensive applications. Anomaly is one of the major threats to the reliability and stability of such systems. System logs, which record system runtime information, have been widely used for anomaly detection. However, existing log-based anomaly detection solutions are facing significant challenges due to the evolution of log statements and the imbalance of log data. In this talk, I will first show the new challenges faced by log-based anomaly detection. Then, I will introduce our recent works that address these challenges by virtue of advanced AI techniques, and make robust and intelligent anomaly detection solutions. Finally, I will talk about more research challenges and open issues.

讲座标题: Federated Learning – Part II Dealing with Data Imbalance
地点: 网络视频，腾讯会议 ID：662 608 005
通知发布时间: 2021-12-06Machine learning typically assume that the samples in the training dataset are well balanced in terms of the embedded features and sample values. However, it may not be the case in realistic scenarios. Especially in the scenario of federated learning, the clients may collect data in different locations and at different times, the data may well be imbalanced. In this talk, we will first discuss the impact of data imbalance on learning and then introduce the existing approaches on dealing with data imbalance. Next, we will present our work in dealing with the data imbalance for regression tasks. In our work, we propose a method to measure the uniqueness in terms of the samples’ feature space and the level of abnormality in terms of the samples’ values. We then associate the samples’ uniqueness and abnormality with the samples’ learning value and integrate them into the loss function. We will also present the evaluation results in the talk.

讲座标题: Federated Learning – Part II Federated Learning in Mobile Edge Computing
地点: 网络视频，腾讯会议 ID：662 608 005
通知发布时间: 2021-11-23In the second talk of this talk series, we will talk about federated learning in Mobile Edge Computing (MEC) systems. We will first talk about the background information in MEC systems, including the architecture of MEC and the challenges in conducting federated learning in MEC. We will then present our recent work in topic. In particular, we propose a new training FL training scheme in MEC. A region-based client selection strategy is first proposed. Further, a multi-level model aggregation mechanism is developed to meet the architecture characteristic of MEC. Evaluation will also be presented.

讲座标题: 生命的量子思维– 来自工业4.0的视角
通知发布时间: 2021-04-19上世纪现代物理的发展特别是量子理论不仅改变了人们对物质世界的认识，由此引伸出的哲学思想将从根本上挑战人们的精神及心理世界，最近工业4.0的发展也进一步触及到人类智能的释放。基于量子物理的发现和工业4.0的进展，报告从宏观到微观，审视我们的宇宙和生存的世界；从什么是物质和能量开始，探索我们是谁？什么是智能？像量子物理触及到传统科学的边界一样，人类的认知也存在类似的测不准原理：模糊和随机的不确定性，触及到传统科学的另一个边界。在此基础上，提出生命的另类思维。结合具体实例，多方面探索生命的深度，揭示影响我们人生的一些基本要素，正确理解思维的力量-- 她是世上所有“成功哲学”的基础。最后回归我们生存的现实空间，从本质上看清：大学和企业、教育和文凭、学术研究和工业应用等之间的关系。通过回顾人类进化中所面临的各种问题，深入分析当今虚拟社会的形成内因，并探讨迎接新时代的各种挑战。报告将横跨多时空领域，穿梭于多学科的交叉，在思维上做一次《星际穿越》Interstellar。

通知发布时间: 2021-04-12The first talk of this talk series will cover two parts: 1) the background of Federated Learning (FL) and 2) our own work in FL. In the first part, the training workflow of FL will be introduced. Two main types of FL protocols, i.e., synchronous and asynchronous protocols, and their pros and cons will be presented. The relation between FL and other technologies, such as other machine learning techniques and distributed computing, will be discussed. In the second part, our own work in FL will be presented. In particular, we develop a new semi-asynchronous training workflow for FL called SAFA. SAFA enables flexible device participation. The FL server can synchronize with tolerance, while clients have the chance to keep partially-trained local modes to reduce the “waste” of local training. Some evaluation results of SAFA will also be presented.
